Russell Levine MD - Hell’s Kitchen Ophthalmology

adrFormatAddress: 630 9th Ave # 1408, New York, NY 10036, USA

originalText.text:
I had an exceptional experience at this ophthalmology office. The staff was friendly and efficient, creating a welcoming atmosphere. Dr. Levine stood out with engaging bedside manners, making the visit comfortable.

What impressed me most was Dr. Levine’s commitment to thorough and comprehensive care. They took the time to provide detailed eye care instructions and preventative measures, ensuring not only immediate well-being but also long-term vision health. I highly recommend this office for their expertise, outstanding service, and genuine concern for patients' vision.

text.text:

What impressed me most was Dr. Levine’s commitment to thorough and comprehensive care. I highly recommend this office for their expertise, outstanding service, and genuine concern for patients' vision.

originalText.text:
Choosing Hell's Kitchen Ophthalmology was probably one of my best medical decisions. Throughout the time of my treatment, I felt I was in capable hands.  The doctor and staff are very professional and provide a waiting area and office that is pleasant to visit. They carefully take measurements and note the features of your eyes using newer electronic instruments. Dr. Levine communicates well and answers questions outside office visits - he or an assistant responded promptly to emails and texts.

I went to Dr. Levine because I suspected cataracts were affecting my vision and might require surgery. His examination verified this, furthermore, he noted an issue with my eyes that would likely require special steps during the operation. I was very relieved that he found this early - and was prepared.  He also seemed motivated and confident of the tasks ahead.
My two surgeries went quickly - I had improved vision soon after - the difference was amazing! The doctor took care to monitor the healing process and made sure the recovery was sound in the weeks that followed. I highly recommend Dr. Levine for his knowledge and skills in surgery.

CM

originalText.text:
I was impressed with my visit to Dr. Levine. His staff is friendly and helpful, and the doctor does not rush— to the contrary, he is exceptionally thorough and takes time to educate patients regarding their eye health. If there’s a wait or a visit runs long, that’s why, and I’m grateful for the time he spends with patients (but will schedule future appointments mindful that it may be a while).

I went to Dr. Levine seeking what I hoped would be a quick fix that other ophthalmologists I’ve seen have given me without question. To his credit, he talked me out of that and explained in detail his reasons in detail. Many clinicians either do whatever a patient wants, whether or not it’s the best course medically, or they summarily and condescendingly refuse without a clear reason.

While I may still seek a second opinion— as I often do— it’s with great respect for Dr. Levine’s experience and reasoning, and I’ll be glad to see him again for my ongoing eye care. I wish more doctors ran their offices like Dr. Levine— the exceptionally rare combination of a modern practice with a level of personal interaction that reminds me of medicine before doctors were constantly rushed and glued to computer screens.

Everyone was polite and professional, and Dr. Levine took a long time both with the examination and explaining everything to me. His office even responded to an email on a Sunday with a question I had about a script. I can highly recommend this practice.
